text:
1. Admission to cardiac care unit
2. Aspirin 100mg QD
3. Arrange coronary angiography

[NIHSS Checklist]
1. Level of Consciousness (LOC)
2. Best Language
3. Best Gaze
4. Facial Palsy
5. Motor Arm (Left)
6. Motor Arm (Right)
7. Motor Leg (Left)
8. Motor Leg (Right)
9. Limb Ataxia
10. Sensory
11. Best Language
12. Neglect
13. Dysarthria
14. Visual Field Loss

NE
E4V5M6
[Cranial nerve]
Pupil reflex 3+/3+
EOM full, VF intact, ptosis(-), nystagmus(-)
Facial sensation: onion skin normal, light touch symmetrical
Facial palsy(-)
Tongue deviation(-)
Dysarthria(-)
[Muscle power]
RUL5, RLL5, LUL5, LLL5
[DTR]
++/++
[Reflex]
Babinski(R/L): withdraw/withdraw
[Cerebellum]
FNF: no dysmetria
HKS: no dysmetria
[Sensation]
Light touch: intact
Pinprick: intact

[ABCD2 Score Checklist]

A - Age
0: Age <60 years
1: Age ≥60 years

B - Blood Pressure
0: Systolic BP <140 mmHg and Diastolic BP <90 mmHg
1: Systolic BP ≥140 mmHg or Diastolic BP ≥90 mmHg

C - Clinical Features
0: No weakness or speech disturbance
2: Weakness (hemiparesis)
1: Speech disturbance without weakness

D - Duration of Symptoms
0: Symptoms <10 minutes
1: Symptoms 10-59 minutes
2: Symptoms ≥60 minutes

D - Diabetes
0: No diabetes
1: Diabetes present
